page.title: 08AFTERNOON AT L.CROSBY SCHOOL
page.content: Most children have a{packed lunch and a few have hot dinners. Only one or two go home for lunch. We say {'Grace'}and go out to play. Mrs. Draper, the{Welfare Assistant,}takes care of us. At 1.15p.m. we all go for afternoon school. On a Thursday we play netball with{Ince Blundell Village School. The next playtime is from 2.45 until 3.00p.m. when we come in again for our {Religious Lesson. My friend David rings the bell at 3.20p.m. After our prayers, those who live in{Hightown}get on the{bus}at 3.30p.m. and the children who live in {Little Crosby}Village{walk}home, the little ones with their mothers who are waiting for them at the school gate.
